data.name: Get the clue
data.description:
In a game conducted, the players have to find a clue to proceed to the next level. Clues are hidden inside objects in an array. Get the clue from each object and join them together. When you reverse it, you get the clue for the next level.

Check the given example:
```js

[
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'go!'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'Now'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'water.'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'drink'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'to'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'need'},
{'game' : 'treasure-hunt', 'level' : 2, 'clue': 'You'},
] 
=> 'You need to drink water. Now go!'
```
(Clues from each object has been joined and reversed)

If an empty array is given, the game can't be continued. So return 'Game cancelled!'

Some objects may not carry any clue!

Good Luck!
